Class AbstractJavaApplicationSchema<A extends JavaApplication<A>,S extends JavaApplicationSchema<A,S>>

java.lang.Object

      com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.AbstractJavaApplicationSchema<A,S>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ApplicationSchema<A,S>, JavaApplicationSchema<A,S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleJavaApplicationSchema
public abstract class AbstractJavaApplicationSchema<A extends JavaApplication<A>,S extends JavaApplicationSchema<A,S>>
extends AbstractApplicationSchema<A,S>
implements JavaApplicationSchema<A,S>

An AbstractJavaApplicationSchema is a base implementation of a JavaApplicationSchema.

Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

setJMXSupport

public S setJMXSupport(boolean enabled)
Enables/Disables JMX support for the build JavaApplications.

This method sets/removes numerous properties to enable/disable JMX. Including:

  1. The remote JMX port to 9000, the Java default for remote JMX management. You can override this setting by calling setJMXPort(int) or setJMXPort(AvailablePortIterator).

  2. The java.rmi.server.hostname to be #LOCAL_HOST You can override this setting by calling setRMIServerHostName(String).

  3. The sun.management.jmxremote.ssl to false (off)

  4. Disables JMX authentication. You can override this setting by calling setJMXAuthentication(boolean).

    Parameters:
    enabled - Should JMX support be enabled
    Returns:
    The JavaApplicationSchema
